page.title: 05LOCAL EMPLOYMENT-within area
page.content: Farming is the biggest single employer of labour accounting for about 40% of the working population,of the remainder the majority travel to nearby towns for work.However,a few people are engaged in agriculturally associated employment provided within the area.A small haulage firm is based at Woolston employing 3 men.A farming machinery repair business employs the owner and one other man.A tree surgeon based at Yarlington employs one man and seasonal casual labour. The livery and riding stables at Maperton is run by the owners and employs in addition 2 or 3 youngsters,the stables concentrate on horses for eventing and show jumping rather than riding lessons and hacking ponies.Seasonal casual employment for young people during the summer within the area is completely dependent on farming.
